blog.name: demonsee2
blog.title: Demon Geek Reborn
blog.description: The rebirth of the Demon Geek.  This is the second iteration of this blog as Tumblr deleted the original.  So join me once again on my journey through Geek culture.  If you want a picture removed contact me directly and don't go crying to Tumblr.

summary: Una imagen conceptual de Cyberpunk 2077 esconde un misterioso secreto
title: Una imagen conceptual de Cyberpunk 2077 esconde un misterioso secreto
body:
Una imagen conceptual de Cyberpunk 2077 esconde un misterioso secreto

CD Projekt RED ha llevado nuevo material de Cyberpunk 2077 a la Gamescom de Colonia. Aunque nos siguen dejando con las ganas de ver el juego en acción, han mostrado capturas y algunos artes conceptuales.

http://nosologamer.com/cyberpunk-2077-nuevas-imagenes/

Es curiosamente en uno de esos artes donde se ha encontrado una pista que al seguirla conduce a una serie de mensajes aún sin terminar…

summary: Otkriven zadivljujući koncept art za Cyberpunk 2077
title: Otkriven zadivljujući koncept art za Cyberpunk 2077
body:
Otkriven zadivljujući koncept art za Cyberpunk 2077

Na prvom danu Gamescom sajma nam je CD Projekt Red prikazao par novih skrinšotova iz Cyberpunk 2077 koji su nam malo zagolicali maštu o tome šta sve možemo očekivati kada se igra eventualno pojavi.

Iako smo očekivali da nam bude predstavljen i neki trejler, poljska kompanija je sada prikazala par concept art fotografija koje bolje prikazuju svet.

Na prvi pogled bi se pomislilo da je u pitanju…

View On WordPress

summary: Raving SJW Mob Sets Sights on CD Projekt Red Employee in Doxxing Over Joke Tweet
title: Raving SJW Mob Sets Sights on CD Projekt Red Employee in Doxxing Over Joke Tweet
body:
Raving SJW Mob Sets Sights on CD Projekt Red Employee in Doxxing Over Joke Tweet

Yesterday we covered how a simple joke reply by the Twitter account for Cyberpunk 2077 snowballed. The account for the game attempted to walk back from the Tweet with an apology, telling fans that there was no malice behind the intent of their joke. But as all things related to an unruly mob, it wasn’t enough.

Now it seems that certain activists are setting their sights upon the actual…

summary: В Cyberpunk 2077 задания будут похожи на Ведьмак 3
title: В Cyberpunk 2077 задания будут похожи на Ведьмак 3
body: Дизайнер заданий Cyberpunk 2077 Патрик Миллс рассказал, что сложные и запутанные поручения в Ведьмак 3 – то, чего будут придерживаться разработчики в качестве примера. «Есть тот, кто даёт задание и есть другой персонаж. Вы можете пойти к этому … Читать дальше »

body:

summary: Cyberpunk 2077 quests similar to The Witcher 3 'in terms of playtime and complexity'
title: Cyberpunk 2077 quests similar to The Witcher 3 'in terms of playtime and complexity'
description:
Speaking to Samuel at Gamescom, quest designer Patrick Mills says logic was crucial while crafting The Witcher 3’s DLC quests. He says he and his team would often ask themselves if certain in-game actions made sense—both in relation to quests and the game’s overarching plot.  

“You’ve got a quest giver, you’ve got a person over here—but you could just go straight to that second person and take the quest from them and do it that way?” says Mills. “[The process] has gotten even more complicated in Cyberpunk—there are more multiple ways to resolve individual quests. Before, there were usually a few ways, a couple of decision points. Now there are whole different ways to play the quest.

"I’ll say it’s a lot of work—they’re very, very complicated—but we try to think: if the player says, ‘an I do this?’ Then, yeah, actually you can, and then you deal with the consequences. That’s part of choice versus consequence—don’t just have that in the dialogues, but have it in the gameplay as well.”

At this stage, Mills isn’t able to determine how often Cyberpunk 2077’s most involving quests pop up, but does liken them to The Witcher 3.

“What I would say is I’d expect something to similar to The Witcher 3,” he says. “Particularly in terms of playtime and in terms of quest complexity. Specifically, I’d even look more at the expansions than The Witcher 3 base game because that’s really where the quest design philosophy that we’re using now came from—it was developed later in the expansions.”

Mills underscores the importance of logic in relation to said design philosophy, before offering a Witcher-related example. For the sake of reference, the following is tied to this (slight spoilers, obviously).

“There was a quest, without getting into too many details, where you had to find a guy’s paint, the paint had been stolen,” says Mills. “When we were developing it, I remember going into the cave where the paint is supposed to be and the paint wasn’t there.

"I signalled this as a bug and said the paint needs to be there—I need to be able to find the paint before the quest begins. And then you have to rewrite the whole quest around the fact that you can in fact find the paint before the quest begins.”

As we reported earlier, Mills also told Samuel CD Projekt Red has “just not been ready” to share Cyberpunk 2077’s elusive E3 demo footage publicly. There’s a new, similarly-structured closed door demo at Gamescom this week, too. Here’s hoping the dev lifts the lid on both sometime soon.
description_abstract:

summary: I'm going through the comments of that non-apology apology Tweet the Cyberpunk 2077 Twitter account made and blocking anyone...
body:
I’m going through the comments of that non-apology apology Tweet the Cyberpunk 2077 Twitter account made and blocking anyone I’ve seen using the words “snowflake,” “triggered,” “SJWs”, etc. for no particular reason because I rarely use my Twitter account.

I’ve noticed that anyone I’ve blocked whose avatar wasn’t some anime shit or a bad meme was a white dude, go figure.

Anyway, gamers are a bunch of moldy fucknuggets.

Anyway, gamers are a bunch of moldy fucknuggets.

summary: Cyberpunk 2077 is meant to be a FPS right? Which means we won't be able to see our characters, their outfits, gestures,...
body:
Cyberpunk 2077 is meant to be a FPS right? Which means we won’t be able to see our characters, their outfits, gestures, movement, various types of interactions with the enviroment around them (apart from what we’ll see in the cutscenes)

What’s the point of an open world then???? :)))) but keeping cd projekt red’s masterpiece The Witcher in mind, I hope they make us for this somehow.

FPS ruins a good game tho. Please don’t drop a COD on us

summary: El diseño de misiones de Cyberpunk 2077 se asemeja a las expansiones de The Witcher 3
title: El diseño de misiones de Cyberpunk 2077 se asemeja a las expansiones de The Witcher 3
body:
El diseño de misiones de Cyberpunk 2077 se asemeja a las expansiones de The Witcher 3

El diseñador de misiones de CD Projekt Red, Patrick Mills, ha comparado las misiones en Cyberpunk 2077 con las expansiones de The Witcher 3, diciendo que ambas son similares “en términos de tiempo de juego y… complejidad”, en una entrevista en Gamescom con PC Gamer.

“Tienes un donante de misiones, tienes a una persona por aquí, pero podrías ir directamente a esa segunda persona y tomar la misión…

View On WordPress

summary: In 2077, cyberware has become as commonplace as tattoos and jewelry. The reasons for installing it are many and varied,...
caption: In 2077, cyberware has become as commonplace as tattoos and jewelry. The reasons for installing it are many and varied, including simple tech upgrades, combat enhancements, and even fashion statements. The possession of trendy cyberware has become an integral and defining part of Night City culture. Uniqueness is just another form of currency. To make it big, you need to look the part. Style is everything.
